intro: Corydalis nokoensis, commonly known as the Noko's Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant has slender, creeping stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
